item.title: æ£’æ£’ç³–å›¾ Rè¯­è¨€
å¥½çœ‹çš„å°æç´å›¾ Rè¯­è¨€
item.description:
```r set.seed(123) # åˆ›å»ºä¸‰ä¸ªä¸åŒæ¡ä»¶ä¸‹çš„æ•°æ® ctrl_data <- data.frame( condition = 'CTRL', FLI1 = rnorm(100, mean = 0.4, sd = 0.15) ) treatment1_data <- data.frame( condition = 'Treatment1', FLI1 = rnorm(100, mean = 0.6, sd = 0.2) ) treatment2_data <- data.frame( condition = 'Treatment2', FLI1 = rnorm(100, mean = 0.75, sd = 0.25) ) # åˆå¹¶æ•°æ® plot_data <- rbind(ctrl_data, treatment1_data, treatment2_data) # ç¡®ä¿æ¡ä»¶æ˜¯å› å­å¹¶è®¾ç½®æ°´å¹³é¡ºåº plot_data$condition <- factor(plot_data$condition, levels = c('CTRL', 'Treatment1', 'Treatment2')) # æŸ¥çœ‹æ•°æ®ç»“æ„ head(plot_data) ``` å¼€å§‹ç”»å›¾ ```r #install.packages('ggcompare') #install.packages('paletteer') library(paletteer) library(ggcompare) library(ggplot2) # é…è‰²æ¥è‡ª 'ggthemes::Tableau_10' ggplot(plot_data, aes(x = condition, y = FLI1,fill = condition,color = condition)) + geom_violin(aes(), trim = FALSE, alpha = 0.6,linewidth = 0.6) + geom_boxplot(aes(),width = 0.3,alpha = 0.4,linewidth = 0.6) + scale_fill_paletteer_d('ggthemes::Tableau_10') + scale_color_paletteer_d('ggthemes::Tableau_10') + labs(x = '', y = 'Expression') + stat_compare(ref_group = 'CTRL',,breaks = c(0, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1)) + scCustomize::theme_ggprism_mod() + theme(panel.grid.major.y = element_line(color = 'gray80', linewidth = 0.5))
ggsave(paste0('violin_',Sys.Date(),'.pdf'),width = 6,height = 4) ```

item.title: å°æç´å›¾çš„ç¾åŒ–ğŸ»
item.description:
```r library(ggplot2) library(patchwork) library(grid) library(ggtext) library(ggsignif) library(stringr) # æ„å»ºç¤ºä¾‹æ•°æ® data <- data.frame( AgeGroup = rep(c('Very ancient', 'Ancient', 'Recent/very recent'), each = 200), Type = rep(rep(c('Reference', 'Specialized for diapause'), each = 100), 3), Value = c( rnorm(100, mean = 0.79, sd = 0.005), rnorm(100, mean = 0.84, sd = 0.005), rnorm(100, mean = 0.15, sd = 0.005), rnorm(100, mean = 0.13, sd = 0.005), rnorm(100, mean = 0.055, sd = 0.005), rnorm(100, mean = 0.03, sd = 0.005) ) ) # ä½¿ç”¨str_wrapå‡½æ•°å¯¹é•¿æ–‡æœ¬è‡ªåŠ¨æ¢è¡Œ data$Type <- str_wrap(data$Type, width = 12) ``` ```r # åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°æ¥ç”Ÿæˆæ¯ç»„çš„å°æç´å›¾ create_violin_plot <- function(data, age_group, title, y_limits, y_breaks, p_position, fill_color, bg_colors) { gradient_grob <- rasterGrob(colorRampPalette(bg_colors)(256), width = unit(1, 'npc'), height = unit(1, 'npc'), interpolate = TRUE) plot <- ggplot(subset(data, AgeGroup == age_group), aes(x = Type, y = Value, fill = Type)) + annotation_custom(gradient_grob,xmin = -Inf, xmax = Inf, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf) + geom_violin(trim = FALSE) + stat_summary(fun.data='mean_sdl', fun.args = list(mult=1), geom='crossbar', width=0.3, size = 0.3) + geom_signif(comparisons = list(c('Reference','Specialized\nfor diapause')), map_signif_level = function(p) {paste('italic(P) == ', sprintf('%.2g', p)) }, y_position = p_position, textsize = 4, tip_length = 0, parse = TRUE) + scale_fill_manual(values = c('#9C9C9C', fill_color)) + scale_y_continuous(limits = y_limits, breaks = y_breaks, expand = c(0, 0)) + labs(title = title, x = NULL, y = 'Fraction of total paralogs') + theme_classic(base_size = 12) + theme(plot.margin = margin(t = 20, r = 10, b = 10, l = 10), plot.title = element_textbox_simple(size = 11, color = 'white', halign = 0.5, fill = fill_color, width = 1.2, padding = margin(3, 0, 3, 0), margin = margin(0, 0, 10, 0)), axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, size = 11, color = 'black'), axis.text.y = element_text(color = 'black'), legend.position = 'none') } # å®šä¹‰æ¯ä¸ªç»„çš„å‚æ•° params <- list( list(age_group = 'Very ancient', title = 'Very ancient
(> 473 mya)', y_limits = c(0.76, 0.88), y_breaks = seq(0.76, 0.88, 0.02), p_position = 0.865, fill_color = '#0EACC9', bg_colors = c('white', '#EDF7F9', '#B1D8E7')), list(age_group = 'Ancient', title = 'Ancient
(111-473 mya)', y_limits = c(0.10, 0.18), y_breaks = seq(0.10, 0.18, 0.02), p_position = 0.17, fill_color = '#A184BC', bg_colors = c('white', '#E8DFF0', '#BFA0CC')), list(age_group = 'Recent/very recent', title = 'Recent/very recent
(0-111 mya)', y_limits = c(0, 0.08), y_breaks = seq(0, 0.08, 0.02), p_position = 0.073, fill_color = '#E57164', bg_colors = c('white', '#FEEBDD', '#F7B78B')) ) ``` ç”»å›¾ ```r # ç”Ÿæˆæ¯ä¸ªç»„çš„å°æç´å›¾ plots <- lapply(params, function(p) { plot <- create_violin_plot(data, p$age_group, p$title, p$y_limits, p$y_breaks, p$p_position, p$fill_color, p$bg_colors) }) # ä½¿ç”¨ patchwork åŒ…ç»„åˆå›¾å½¢ combined_plot <- wrap_plots(plots, ncol = 3) # æ˜¾ç¤ºç»„åˆåçš„å›¾å½¢ print(combined_plot) ``` ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c2b29cd-2c37-4c73-9196-fef2e96d3e76) ã€‚

item.title: å¦‚ä½•åˆ©ç”¨AIï¼ˆå¦‚ChatGPTï¼‰è¾…åŠ©æ³¨é‡Šå•ç»†èƒæ•°æ®ï¼Ÿ
item.description:
## prompt
> Identify cell types of human prostate cells using the following markers. Identify one cell type for each row. Only provide the cell type name.Some could be a mixture of multiple cell types. Some could be unknown cell types.
## æ‰©å±•prompt
Identify cell types of human PBMCs using the following markers. Identify one primary cell type for each cluster. If a cluster is likely a mixture of multiple cell types, specify the primary cell type and mention the possible mixture. For unknown clusters, label them as 'unknown'. Use marker databases or reference datasets for validation and provide a brief justification or reference for each identified cell type.
Markers:
cluster0: RASAL2, TRAT1, MAL, INPP4B, MYC, LEF1, BCL2, PRKCA, BCL11B, TNFRSF25, TRABD2A, TESPA1, IL7R, LTB, MDFIC
cluster1: GZMH, CCL5, KLRG1, CD8A, FCRL6, A2M, PZP, CST7, GZMA, ADGRG1, C1orf21, NKG7, LYAR, CD8B2, MYBL1
My goal is to identify each cluster as accurately as possible.
ã€‚

# ç¯å¢ƒåˆ›å»ºåŠè½¯ä»¶å®‰è£…ï¼ˆå¿…é¡»ï¼‰
```Shell conda create -n snakemake -y && conda activate snakemake && conda install mamba -y && mamba install python=3.10 -y && mamba install snakemake -y && mamba install -y sra-tools fastqc trim-galore hisat2 subread multiqc samtools salmon fastp ```

mkdir -p data/rawdata/sra data/rawdata/fastq data/rawdata/qc data/cleandata/trim_galore data/cleandata/fastqc data/cleandata/multiqc mkdir -p Mapping/Hisat2 mkdir -p Expression/featureCounts tree ```

## å‚è€ƒåŸºå› ç»„æ–‡ä»¶
```Shell nohup wget https://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-100/fasta/homo_sapiens/dna/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.dna.toplevel.fa.gz & ```
## åŸºå› ç»„æ³¨é‡Šæ–‡ä»¶
```Shell wget https://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-100/gtf/homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.100.gtf.gz ```
# æ•°æ®ä¸‹è½½åŠè§£å‹ ï¼ˆéå¿…é¡»å†…å®¹ï¼Œè¿™åªæ˜¯å‰æœŸå†™çš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¸‹è½½è½¬æ¢ä»£ç ï¼‰
```Shell #!/bin/bash
# å°†æ­¤è„šæœ¬çš„æ‰€æœ‰è¾“å‡ºé‡å®šå‘åˆ°æ—¥å¿—æ–‡ä»¶ exec > download_and_convert.log 2>&1
# SRR IDæ•°ç»„ srr_ids=('SRR17214819' 'SRR17214820') # æ ¹æ®éœ€è¦æ·»åŠ æ›´å¤šSRR ID
# åŸå§‹æ•°æ®ç›®å½• sra_data_dir='./data/rawdata/sra' # FASTQæ–‡ä»¶çš„è¾“å‡ºç›®å½• fastq_data_dir='./data/rawdata/fastq'
# æ£€æŸ¥ç»™å®šSRR IDçš„FASTQæ–‡ä»¶æ˜¯å¦å·²å­˜åœ¨çš„å‡½æ•° check_fastq_files_exist() { local srr_id=$1 # æŸ¥æ‰¾æ ¼å¼ä¸º '${srr_id}_*.fastq.gz' çš„FASTQæ–‡ä»¶ local files=('${fastq_data_dir}/${srr_id}'_*.fastq.gz)
# æ£€æŸ¥æ˜¯å¦æ‰¾åˆ°ä»»ä½•æ–‡ä»¶ if [ -e '${files[0]}' ]; then return 0 # æ–‡ä»¶å­˜åœ¨ else return 1 # æ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ fi }
# éå†æ¯ä¸ªSRR ID for srr_id in '${srr_ids[@]}'; do # æ£€æŸ¥FASTQæ–‡ä»¶æ˜¯å¦å·²å­˜åœ¨ if check_fastq_files_exist '$srr_id'; then echo 'FASTQæ–‡ä»¶ $srr_id å·²å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œè·³è¿‡...' continue fi
# SRAæ–‡ä»¶çš„è·¯å¾„ sra_file='${sra_data_dir}/${srr_id}/${srr_id}.sra'
# æ£€æŸ¥SRAæ–‡ä»¶æ˜¯å¦å·²å­˜åœ¨ if [[ -f '$sra_file' ]]; then echo 'SRAæ–‡ä»¶ $srr_id å·²å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œä½†FASTQæ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨ï¼Œè¿›è¡Œè½¬æ¢...' else # Prefetch echo 'å¼€å§‹é¢„å– $srr_id' prefetch '$srr_id' -O '$sra_data_dir' &
# ç­‰å¾…prefetchå®Œæˆ wait fi
# Fastq-dump echo 'å¼€å§‹è½¬æ¢ $srr_id' fastq-dump --split-files --gzip '$sra_file' --outdir '$fastq_data_dir' &
# ç­‰å¾…fastq-dumpå®Œæˆ wait done
echo 'æ‰€æœ‰è¿‡ç¨‹å·²å®Œæˆã€‚

item.title: å•ç»†èƒ-COSGé‰´å®šmarkeråŸºå›
item.description:
## COSGæ˜¯ä»€ä¹ˆ
**COSG**(COSine similarity-based marker Gene identification)æ˜¯ç”±æ¥è‡ªå“ˆä½›åŒ»å­¦é™¢å’ŒBroadç ”ç©¶æ‰€åšåMing Daiç­‰äººå¼€å‘ï¼Œæ—¨åœ¨ä»ä½™å¼¦ç›¸ä¼¼åº¦çš„è§’åº¦é‰´å®šclusterçš„marker geneï¼Œäº2021å¹´12æœˆè¢«Briefings in Bioinformaticsæ¥æ”¶ã€‚
